Не стандартная игра на мой взгляд. И стрелялка и логическая. Нет это не минус это даже наоборот плюс.  Вы узко-глазая девушка (ни че так :-) ) заперты очень глубоко под землей и вам надо выбраться из этой жуткой лаборатории, но вам не дает этого сделать злой робот которая управляет всем комплексом (что-то из «обителя зла»). Так вот она заставляет вас проходит комнаты с испытаниями, так она оценивает мозговую активность и логику человека. Может показаться что игра скучная вот вот надоест, но нет, тут все время что-то меняется и добавляется в ходе игры.
kkkuh

Finished
7.5/10

Le principal défaut de Portal est sa durée de vie qui est relativement courte, mais il est palliée par l'ambiance globale du jeu !

En effet, nous avons droit à des décors qui sont simplistes mais, efficaces car, ils nous plongent au sein d'un laboratoire dans lequel nous devrons passer plusieurs salles de tests.
Le scénario ainsi que le gameplay se complexifient au fur et à mesure que l'aventure progresse.
Les doublages français et anglais nous immerge totalement dans l'histoire et la musique est un véritable chef-d'oeuvre qui restera, à jamais, graver dans votre mémoire.

Tous ces éléments font que Portal est un jeu assez court, mais néanmoins culte !
Cake! :D
Kickass game. It completely blows my mind how they could get something like this to work.

Hilarious dialogue (well, monologue). Great atmosphere, very fitting for the subject. Really fun too.

Portal, is an absolute masterpeice it's innovative and original concept. Using the 'Portal Gun' to complete GLaDOS' challenging, yet fun, test chambers is an interesting experience. Your only friend (and sometimes un-friend) is the AI who watches over you, GLaDOS, comments in FULL about every single mistake you make, just to rustle your Jimmies :) On top of that, the sense of overral abandoning and isolation make for a chilling atmosphere in the test-chambers, especially because the only human face you'll ever see...
...is your own.

Most of you have played this game by now... if not, do it.  It's short, sweet, hilarious, fun, engaging, and tough without being cruel.  Maybe the most perfect game I've ever played, from a holistic approach.

It's short but hell-of-a-lot-of-fun. So that's why I bought Portal 2.

Portal is one of the most fun games I have played in a long time. It is a combination of first person camera view with an almost pure puzzle solving game style which is an awesome combination in my opinion. 
The events of Portal take place within the Half Life universe. During the game, you take control of Chell, who wakes up inside the Aperture Science Enrichment Center. You are informed by GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) that you will be participating in the testing of the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. As you progress through the testing chamber, it becomes more readily apparent that all is not as it originally seemed.
The portal gun adds a whole new dimension to puzzle solving. All throughout the game, you are presented with situations that will seem near impossible to overcome. After some thought, it becomes clear how you can use the portal gun to solve the puzzle. As the game progresses,  the complexity of the puzzles increases and you often have to think two or three moves ahead in order to progress further.
After you complete the game, two new modes, Challenge and Advanced, are unlocked. The Challenge mode forces players to solve the same puzzles again, but this time, with time or movement limits restricting them. Advanced mode simply ups the difficulty of puzzles by adding new obstacles and hazards.
Portal is extremely short. It will take only a few hours to complete the whole game but the minimal time you will spend with the game, is well-worth the money.

Sounds 9/10
Graphics 9/10
Gameplay 9/10
Atmosphere 9/10
